page.title: 01THE AREA AROUND HACKLINGE
page.content: The Hacklinge area is between Sandwich in the north and Northbourne in the south,Eastry is to the west and the sea at Sandwich Bay to the east. It lies on part of the Kent coalfield. Shafts from the mine at Betteshanger in the southwest fan out under the area. The Sandwich-Deal road cuts across from northwest to southeast and the Southern Railway line traverses the northeast corner. A track built to take coal from the pit to the main line is evident but unused, the coal is now taken by lorry along roads unfit for such vehicles. The largest populated areas are in Finglesham and the mining community at the pit head.The main surface industry is farming but most of the land is worked by farmers living outside the area.
